Recap: Blair continues to search the abandoned room for any info that will lead her to Todd. Dorian insists that Spencer Truman has not hurt Todd. Layla advises Evangeline that if Evangeline and Christian don't trust each other then they don't need to be parents. Evangeline receives a call from Blair concerning Todd. Miles tells Nash that Jessica collapsed in the hospital and they were running tests on her. Natalie visits Jessica in her hospital room. John and Marty discuss Cole and his use of steroids. Starr and Langston lets Cole know what Britney had said to Henry. Cole blasts Britney. Henry comes up and tells Britney that he has something for her and it might hurt.

Henry has a pair of clip-on earrings for Britney. Britney refuses them in no uncertain terms. Starr, Langston and Cole advise Henry to forget Britney. In the distance, Henry overhears Britney and her friends laughing at him. Blair fills Evangeline in on what has been happening with Todd. Evangeline tells Layla that Todd is missing. Miles overhears. Nash arrives at the hospital and looks through the window of Jessica's room. Antonio sees Nash and they begin to argue. Antonio orders him out of the hospital. A security guard comes up and wants to know what is the disturbance. Antonio tells the guard that he wants Nash out of there.
Transcript: Blair: It is possible that it's not Todd's blood?
Det. Morris: The test is a definitive DNA match. I'm sorry.
Dorian: I think what my niece is trying to establish --
Blair: He knows what I'm trying to establish, Dorian. Todd's hurt -- or worse.

Det. Morris: We'll open an official investigation. Suspicion of foul play. But I have to be honest with you, Ms. Cramer. There really isn't anything to go on except that blood stain, and that could make it difficult.
Blair: What have they done to you, Todd?

Langston: Right -- because it's so easy to get over somebody.

She clearly doesn't know what's best for her. She needs someone to take care of her, someone who can think ahead for her. I have a plan. A plan for our lives."

John: Look, it's -- it's not about what he said, it's -- it's more about where he came to see me, and I felt obligated to come tell you about that.

Det. Morris: I'm available 24/7, Ms. Cramer, if you need my help.

Dorian: No. Actually, what I was going to say is, what do you want to do now?
Blair: What I want to do? I want to roll the clock back so I can figure out why Todd came here. But since I can't do that, I'm going to try to figure out what -- what he was looking to find here.
[Dorian sighs]

Viki: I wish she could tell us what's wrong with her.
Miles: What happened? I mean, what could've caused her to collapse?
Natalie: I don't know -- I mean, they've tested her for all the obvious things. You know, pregnancy, a virus. But you know, every time they keep ruling out something simple, it makes us more nervous.
Miles: Can I see her?
Natalie: Well, mom and Antonio are in there with her right now, and she really needs her rest. I'll -- I'll give her your wishes.

Natalie: Hey. Did she wake up at all?
Viki: No, darling, but you know, they sedated her for the tests, so she probably won't come around for a while.

Natalie: God, it's just so weird. I mean, seeing Jessica like this, you know, it's just -- it's not right not having Jessica around being Jessica. But, hey, you know, she's going to be up and out of here bossing us around soon.

Jessica: Is he here?
Antonio: I'm right here, baby.
Jessica: Yeah, I was looking for you. Of course, I was looking for you.
Antonio: How are you doing?
Jessica: I'm -- fine. I'm a little tired, though, and I'm achy. What time is it?
Viki: It's 1:00 in the afternoon, sweetheart.
Jessica: Oh.
Antonio: Why?
Jessica: Oh, no reason. Um -- where's Jamie and Bree?
Antonio: Well, Bree's fine. Jamie's home now. You need to rest.
Jessica: Oh. Guys, what, did somebody die? I said I was fine.
Viki: Good. You're actually getting some color back into your face.
Jessica: Ok.
Natalie: I spoke with dad. I mean, he's chartering planes all over the place just to get home so he can see you.
Jessica: There's no reason to do that. I just have a bug or something.
Viki: Well, then maybe you'll be all better by the time he gets back.
Natalie: Hmm.
Jessica: Um -- no, I -- I can't help but worry about the girls. I -- I mean -- Bree -- doesn't Nash want to be with Bree? Isn't it his day or something?
Antonio: No, actually, he's not scheduled to be with her till tomorrow.
Jessica: Oh.
[Phone vibrates]
Antonio: Hold on. It's R.J. he's calling about Jamie.
Jessica: That's ok, go get it. Give her my love.
Antonio: All right, I'll be right back, ok?
Viki: See if the test results are in, ok?
Natalie: You go, mom. I'll stay here with her.
Viki: I'll be right back.
Natalie: So -- feeling better?
Jessica: Yeah, Natalie, I'm fine. I'm just a little restless, that's all.
Natalie: You're going to be out of here soon.
Jessica: Uh -- does Nash know I'm in the hospital?
Natalie: I'm guessing not, or I'm sure he'd be fighting with Antonio to come in here and see you. What's going on, Jess? Are you starting to feel for Nash what he feels for you?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Nash: Yes, Jessica, it's me, Nash, for the gazillionth time. Please, look, I'm getting really worried about you. When you -- when you get this, please call me back. Let me know that you're ok.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Layla: Are you saying you wish you were pregnant?

But I was also kind of excited. Thinking about the fact that Cristian and I might have created a life together.
Layla: Mm-hmm.
Evangeline: Thinking about what an adventure it would be to raise a child.
Layla: So it actually was a letdown when the test was negative?

Evangeline: I went back and forth. Sometimes I was scared to death, and then the next minute, I would be thrilled. And if I was that conflicted about a pregnancy that wasn't real, imagine how I would have felt if I was actually carrying a child.
Layla: You'd have dealt with it, the way you deal with everything. You'd have risen to the occasion. And I think that -- no, I know you'll be an amazing mother one day.
Evangeline: I don't know. Maybe m too selfish,. I mean, you know how I am about my work and -- and my freedom.
Layla: No, I do. That's why it's probably better that it's not happening right now. Isn't it? Better?
Evangeline: I don't know. I just -- I can't help feeling let down.
Layla: Vange, it's me here.
Evangeline: Maybe -- maybe I'm more ready to have a child than I ever thought I could be, you know? Cristian's child.

Bartender: What can I get you?

Blair: Spencer Truman.

Britney: Oh -- so Mrs. Mc-Pain-In-The-Ass is announcing the cast list for the musical tomorrow. I wonder if you and I will get the leads.

Henry: I have something for you.
Britney: Are you like, proposing to me?
Henry: It's not a ring. Remember these? When we were at the mall, you said you really liked them.

Britney: People don't like them because they're lame. Clip-ons? Do I look like your grandmother? Are you for real?
Starr: Henry, they're really pretty. Britney doesn't deserve them.
Cole: Yeah, come on, we'll take them back to the jewelry store. You -- you kept the receipt, right?

Starr: No, she's a bitch, ok? You don't deserve to be treated like that. Nobody does.

Starr: Henry, Britney is wrong about you, ok? We like you.

Langston: It's true, Henry.
Starr: Yeah, it's Britney that nobody likes. Don't you get that?
Henry: Huh. It's always the same. People not liking me, and never saying why. After a while, you get used to it.
Cole: Henry, come on, man. You can't let her get to you like this. All right, she's one girl that has a bunch of other dumb girls who follow her because of her clothes, period.
Henry: You know, these really are ugly. Hmm. Maybe I wanted her to not like them.
Starr: What?
Henry: Maybe I wanted her to see what a big loser I am so that when all this goes to crap, we'll all remember it.
Starr: When all what goes to crap, Henry?
Britney: He tried to give me clip-on earrings.
Henry: Only a loser would have thought that a girl like Britney would like someone like me -- see that I was worth something.
Langston: Don't say that.
Henry: Only an idiot would have believed her when she said she liked me.
Starr: No, Henry --
[SCENE_BREAK]

John: Hmm. He's obviously grown up with a lot of love and support.

Layla: Be real with yourself, please. I love you more than anybody in the world. And even if you were pregnant, I'd be there. I'd hold your hand and be your birth buddy or whatever. But I wouldn't be a good sister if I just told you what you wanted to hear.

Evangeline: Hit me.

Layla: No. The fact that you're not pregnant tells me that somebody upstairs is looking out for you. You've got time, girl. And now, you know this is something that you want.
Evangeline: Yeah. Yeah, I guess I just thought it was something that would come later in my life, you know?
Layla: One more piece of sisterly advice?

Layla: A kid is not a court case. And neither is a relationship. Take care of Vange for a while. And I have a feeling that the big life stuff -- it'll fall into place.
